text:
Hi, so glad I found this group a while ago to be able to ask this...

After 4 years of being responsible for content marketing at my company and building out a team of 6 under me, the moment has finally come for me to hire a Content Lead under myself. They will be taking over 2-3 writers and taking over responsibility for the content calendar, overseeing content quality, working with freelancers, polishing content processes, building out more content capacity, etc.

My question is... How the frick do I not fall flat on my face hiring for this role? 

I've hired writers before, but I've never hired a lead and never someone who would be "inheriting" existing team members. How can I check whether they can run 1 on 1s well and set goals for team members and provide excellent feedback for content and drive the content strategy and etc etc etc... All within one recruitment process?!

Any advice at all from you fine people would be greatly appreciated :pray:

text:
Congrats! First, is there anyone on your team who could move into the role? 

If not, I would be looking for emotional intelligence, self-awareness, curiosity, growth mindset, and cognitive ability, in addition to strategic content marketing acumen. 

You can easily show someone how to do basic management tasks like running a 1 on 1, giving feedback, and setting goals. :grinning: Not having that experience isn’t a problem in my eyes.

text:
Hi Erin, thanks for taking the time to respond. I spoke with my team but they're happy to remain individual contributors and don't want to start managing people—and I respect that.

Your list of traits to look for makes sense, although I find myself wondering how do I interview for emotional intelligence etc?

I'm also wondering whether I should set up a recruitment task for this role and if so, what type of task would work here. Having them review the first draft of one of our articles perhaps, to see how they give feedback and what elements of content they pay attention to?

So many questions still :exploding_head:
